DataElement.preferredName: Intervention Trial Study Protocol Version Control Group Temporal Type Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying the temporal relationships of the control to the study intervention. EXAMPLE(S): concurrent, historical, pre/post (patient owned control).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intervention Trial Study Protocol Version Control Group Temporal Type Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A group used as a standard of comparison in a control experiment.:Of or relating to time or limited by time.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.

The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: A group used as a standard of comparison in a control experiment.:Of or relating to time or limited by time.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: A group used as a standard of comparison in a control experiment.
Of or relating to time or limited by time.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
